segments.text: The kitchen feels like a ticking time bomb; I can't look away from the chaos brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see water spilling everywhere while the woman just keeps drying her plates without a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s absurdly funny how the boy thinks he can manage to grab those cookies by standing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s expression is so full of anticipation—she really believes she’s about to get a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the reality is, there’s a high chance they'll both end up in a heap on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t decide if I want to laugh or scream at how oblivious the adult is to everything happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She stands there in her dress and apron, completely disconnected from the madness unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the sunlight streams through the window makes everything feel deceptively calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like the outside world is giving a false sense of tranquility while chaos reigns inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll notice when the water finally reaches her feet; it’s only a matter of time.
segments.speaker: PAR
